During locoregional anaesthesia, the local anaesthetics used act on nerve conduction by blocking voltage-dependent sodium channels. The action potential can no longer be conducted along the nerve fibre.

question.question: During locoregional anaesthesia, local anaesthetics primarily act by:
question.option_a: Blocking calcium channels in the nerve membrane
question.option_b: Increasing the permeability of the nerve membrane to potassium ions
question.option_d: Enhancing the release of neurotransmitters at the synapse
